clinical_study.brief_title: Neoadjuvant Toripalimab Plus Platinum-based Doublet for Stage III Non-small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Study of Neoadjuvant Toripalimab Plus Platinum-based Doublet for Potentially Resectable Stage III Non-small Cell Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, single-arm, phase II, multi-center clinical trial. Thirty patients will be enrolled in this trial to investigate the pathological complete response rate defined as the absence of residual tumor in lung and lymph nodes treated by chemo-immunotherapy.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is an open-label, single-arm, phase II, multi-center clinical trial. Eligible patients will receive Toripalimab 240mg + Albumin-bound paclitaxel 260mg/m2 + Carboplatin AUC5 for 3 cycles every 21 days (+/-3 days) as neoadjuvant treatment followed by surgery 3-4 weeks after the last dose of chemo-immunotherapy.
The primary objective is pathological complete response (pCR) defined as the absence of residual tumor in lung and lymph nodes after neoadjuvant treatment. Patient accrual is expected to be completed within 18 months excluding a run-in-phase of 3 months. Patients will be followed 3 years after surgery. The study will end once survival follow-up has concluded.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the pathological complete response (pCR)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of enrollment until the date of first documented progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, assessed up to 45 months
primary_outcome.description: The pathological complete response is defined as the absence of residual tumor in lung and lymph nodes in patients treated with chemo-immunotherapy.

arm_group.description: Neoadjuvant treatment (Albumin-bound paclitaxel + carboplatin + toripalimab) will start within 1-3 days from enrollment at 21-day (+/-3 days) intervals (Q3W) prior to surgery. Before surgery a tumor assessment will be done to exclude evidence of progression. Patients with radiographically stable disease or partial response may be considered for operation. Surgery: Surgery must be done within the 3rd to 4th week (+7 days) from day 21 cycle 3 of neoadjuvant treatment.

intervention.description: Eligible patients will receive Toripalimab 240mg + Albumin-bound paclitaxel 260mg/m2 + Carboplatin AUC5 for 3 cycles every 21 days (+/-3 days) as neoadjuvant treatment
